availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer. Hart County native. Son of Silas Harper and Elizabeth Harper. Married to Anna C. Logsdon Harper on April 15, 1852. Father of Garland E. Harper, Silas Lee Harper, Joseph W. Harper, and Mary E. Harper. Farmer in Hart County in 1850 and 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 177. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 52. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Munfordville, p. 2. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Hart County, 1852, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
